content.description: A group of 25 American college students who were taking introductory psychology during the spring semester participated in a study about cognition. Participants were first asked to read a story about a Russian battle from the 19th century. Later, participants were asked to write down as many details as they could remember from the story. Twenty-two out of 25 of the students changed some of the details of the story, such as referring to a “house” instead of using the Russian word “dacha” that was used in the story.
content.question: If this study were to run as an experiment, which of the following would be necessary?

choices.label: The study must examine at least 200 participants to be valid.
There must be a predictable relationship between the variables examined in the study.
The results of the study must be significant.
The participants must be randomly assigned to a control or experimental condition.

content.answer: The participants must be randomly assigned to a control or experimental condition.

skill.text: 2.A: Determine the type of research design(s) used in a given study.
